items.name: Welcome
items.label: ![Welcome](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44091884/110779389-63077500-825b-11eb-81a5-fd9572fed090.png)

items.name: Welcome1
items.label:
####

You are being asked to participate in this 15 MINUTE SURVEY ( 36 QUESTIONS IN TOTAL) to create a profile of the 2020/2021 digital landscape and experiences by staff and students in TU Dublin. By asking you these questions, we aim to collect feedback on what worked and did not work, during the increased use of technology for education since the start of the pandemic. Questions are based on the National Forum’s INDEx (Irish National Digital Experience) survey which staff and students completed in 2019, with some additions relevant to teaching and learning spaces and experiences post COVID.

As a stakeholder, your opinions and expectations must be accommodated into the design and improvement of any digital services provided by TU Dublin. Covid-19 rapidly changed how third-level education was taught. In light of this, it is important to reflect on the positives and negatives of our online experiences.

####

Through feedback from students and staff, we will aim to compile a picture of the advantages and disadvantages of greater use of technology during COVID, to inform decisions concerning the TU Dublin digital campus into the future. A report summarising survey results, including a comparison with 2019’s INDEx survey results, and a recent CSO report on the use of technology more generally in Ireland, will be circulated internally in TU Dublin to all interested parties. We may also consider publishing results in a peer-reviewed publication. Your data will not be used for any other purpose and will be deleted within 1 year of the project completion.

####

For further information contact:

####

geraldine.gray@tudublin.ie (TU Dublin Blanchardstown campus)

####

eugene.hickey@tudublin.ie (TU Dublin Tallaght Campus)

####

kevin.orourke@tudublin.ie (TU Dublin City campus)

####

cormac.mcmahon@tudublin.ie (TU Dublin City campus).
items.label_parsed:
You are being asked to participate in this 15 MINUTE SURVEY ( 36 QUESTIONS IN TOTAL) to create a profile of the 2020/2021 digital landscape and experiences by staff and students in TU Dublin. By asking you these questions, we aim to collect feedback on what worked and did not work, during the increased use of technology for education since the start of the pandemic. Questions are based on the National Forum’s INDEx (Irish National Digital Experience) survey which staff and students completed in 2019, with some additions relevant to teaching and learning spaces and experiences post COVID.

As a stakeholder, your opinions and expectations must be accommodated into the design and improvement of any digital services provided by TU Dublin. Covid-19 rapidly changed how third-level education was taught. In light of this, it is important to reflect on the positives and negatives of our online experiences.

Through feedback from students and staff, we will aim to compile a picture of the advantages and disadvantages of greater use of technology during COVID, to inform decisions concerning the TU Dublin digital campus into the future. A report summarising survey results, including a comparison with 2019’s INDEx survey results, and a recent CSO report on the use of technology more generally in Ireland, will be circulated internally in TU Dublin to all interested parties. We may also consider publishing results in a peer-reviewed publication. Your data will not be used for any other purpose and will be deleted within 1 year of the project completion.

For further information contact:

kevin.orourke@tudublin.ie (TU Dublin City campus)

cormac.mcmahon@tudublin.ie (TU Dublin City campus).
